data.title: Semordnilaps
data.statement:
Extract a pair of <<semordnilaps>> from an input sentence if exists.

<<Semordnilap>> – a word which is a different word when spelled in reverse: <<top>> ↔ <<pot>>, <<live>> ↔ <<evil>>, <<spots>> ↔ <<stops>>, etc.

For this task, we define 2 words to be a <<semordnilap pair>> if they both appear in the input sentence.

Separate the words by a single space character. If no such words exist, print {{<missing>}}.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn: What I saw was completely out of the ordinary.

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: O dicta nou rem dignissimos mer nihil.

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn: I am stressed, need some desserts!

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: Ut e nisi qui quae inventore, erotnevni!

testCases.title: Preserve case
testCases.testIn: Step carefully, I have snakes as pets.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: Iste a nulla et, etsi baal.

testCases.title: It is not a different word
testCases.testIn: Mom of my mom is my grandmom.

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testIn: Dad of my dad is my granddad.

data.constraints:
<<0 or 1>> semordnilap pair in the input sentence.
Words consist only of <<alphabetic English letters>>.
The sentence can contain <<punctuation>> characters.
4 ≤ input length < 100.
data.inputDescription: 1 line: a valid sentence with or without semordnilap words.
data.outputDescription: 2 space-separated words in the <<same order and case>> as they appear in the input sentence, or {{<missing>}} if no such pair exists.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Extract a pair of semordnilaps from an input sentence if exists.

Semordnilap – a word which is a different word when spelled in reverse: top ↔ pot, live ↔ evil, spots ↔ stops, etc.

For this task, we define 2 words to be a semordnilap pair if they both appear in the input sentence.

Separate the words by a single space character. If no such words exist, print <missing>.
Input
1 line: a valid sentence with or without semordnilap words.
Output
2 space-separated words in the same order and case as they appear in the input sentence, or <missing> if no such pair exists.
Constraints
0 or 1 semordnilap pair in the input sentence.
Words consist only of alphabetic English letters.
The sentence can contain punctuation characters.
4 ≤ input length < 100.
Example
Input
What I saw was completely out of the ordinary.
Output
saw was
